message.content:
{"id": "4971", "title": "Strange 'copy package'", "description": "When performing the 'copy package' operation in the 'Package Viewer' in the 'org.eclipse.jdt.internal.ui' plugin, I encountered a strange behavior. After selecting a package and choosing 'copy' from the context menu, the package 'ui' was erroneously included in the destination project. This behavior was observed in project 'xxx'.", "OB": "After performing the 'copy package' operation, the package 'ui' was copied to the destination project 'xxx'.", "EB": "", "SR": "To reproduce the issue: 
1. Create a new project (e.g. 'xxx2').
2. Open the 'Package Viewer'.
3. Select a package in project 'A'.
4. From the context menu, choose 'copy'.
5. Verify that the package 'ui' is not included in the copied package in the destination project 'xxx2'."}

origin.input_content:
<BUG REPORT>
{'id': '4971', 'title': "Bug 4971Strange 'copy package'", 'description': "Bug 4971Strange 'copy package' 2031. org.eclipse.jdt.internal.ui in jdt.ui3. Select xxx as destination5. ", 'OB': "As result, xx contains a package 'ui'. ", 'EB': '', 'SR': 'Create a new project xxx2. Package viewer: Select a package in project Ae.g. From the context menu choose copy4. '}
